title: Multimodal Learning Style-Adapted Design for Online Language Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language comprehension skills and fundamental digital device usage abilities
context.additional_context: Post-VARK model-based learning style diagnosis, providing customized content and optimizing for smartphone environments.

learning_goals: Learners identify their dominant learning style (visual, auditory, reading-writing, kinesthetic) using the VARK diagnostic tool.

Learners apply three or more online language-learning strategies (text summarization, audio recording, image association, hands-on practice) aligned with their learning style and achieve 80% or higher comprehension of the material.
Learners propose personalized optimized learning methods through project-based assessment (weekly language use journal + learning style-integrated plan).

resources: Multimodal language learning materials with text/image/audio samples
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
